newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: PLDT falls 3.68 pct on intl rate cut news.
newsitem.headline: PLDT falls 3.68 pct on intl rate cut news.

text.p: Shares of the Philippine Long Distance Telephone Co dropped 35 pesos, or 3.68 percent, to 915 pesos in Wednesday's midsession on news of a cut in international call rates.

"There's news that there will soon be a slash in their international rates and people expect it may affect their earnings," said Jose Ricardo Garcia, executive vice-president at Diversified Securities.
"It's because talks with AT&T are mentioning a rate cut bigger than what the market expected meaning there will be more losses," said Noel Reyes, vice-president at Anscor-Hagedorn Securities.

PLDT documents submitted to the National Telecommunications Commission on Tuesday showed that the firm will stand to lose two billion pesos this year if international rates are cut and the government fails to approve its new rate plan.
The plan calls for an increase in basic local phone charges and the implementation of a call metering scheme that will compensate for the reduction in accounting rates.
Accounting rates refer to the cost shared by a Philippine firm with its foreign counterpart carrier for every minute of international long distance calls.
A PLDT offficial said AT&T was eyeing a reduction of accounting rates to $0.70 per minute from the existing $1.0.
PLDT was the third most actively traded stock in midsession.
